avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of a moderate to strong wind from northerly directions, further wind slabs will form in high Alpine regions. The wind slabs can be released easily by a single winter sport participant. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls above approximately 2500 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack.
In particular in steep rocky terrain and on very steep grassy slopes moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. The avalanche prone locations for wet avalanches are to be found in particular below approximately 2300 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: As a consequence of the moderate to strong northerly wind the prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase. Moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.

snowpackStructure.comment: Fresh wind slabs are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2500 m. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment: The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can still be released in some cases especially on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2700 m. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in gullies and bowls and in the vicinity of peaks. In some places new snow is lying on an icy crust. Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls. In particular on very steep sunny slopes mostly small moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Fresh wind slabs represent the main danger, especially along the border with France. Moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.

snowpackStructure.comment: Below approximately 2200 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at intermediate and high altitudes.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released in particular on very steep north, east and southeast facing slopes. The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular in gullies and bowls above approximately 2500 m and at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released in some cases even by a single winter sport participant. In particular in high Alpine regions these avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
In particular in steep rocky terrain and on very steep grassy slopes moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming. The avalanche prone locations for wet avalanches are to be found in particular below approximately 2400 m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The wind slabs of the last few days represent the main danger. Moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.

snowpackStructure.comment: Snow depths vary greatly at intermediate and high altitudes, depending on the infuence of the wind. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at low and intermediate altitudes. At low altitude only a little snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Very early morning: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.

snowpackStructure.comment: In all altitude zones hardly any snow is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment: Very early morning: Even in moderately steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the icy crust. In particular on very steep sunny slopes and at higher altitudes individual small moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: From a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying. Isolated small moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming.

snowpackStructure.comment: In particular at low and intermediate altitudes hardly any snow is lying. Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise as the day progresses to increasing moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes at elevated altitudes.
